pullRequest.body:
We define an extended version of the exponential from `EReal` to `ENNReal` and prove some properties in relation to the extended log.

- [x] Rename `ENNReal.lean` to `ENNRealLog.lean`
- [x] Add `ENNRealExp.lean`
- [x] Add `ENNRealLogExp.lean`

See [this](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Porting.20TopologicalEntropy.20into.20Mathlib/near/446665481) Zulip discussion.

Co-authored-by: @RemyDegenne @pitmonticone @D-Thomine 


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

bors d+
Thanks!

bors d+
Thanks!

```suggestion
  induction x <;> simp [Real.exp_pos]
```
Same thing below.

```suggestion
- `EReal.exp_homeomorph`: `exp` as a homeomorphism.
```
Also, it feels weird to have the order_iso version of the log but not of the exponential.

`logOrderIso` actually contains the exponential as its `invFun`:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/7ba4a1a7efa52aa3873d0ba28eb391c73280e7ea/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Log/ENNRealLogExp.lean#L115-L120

So to access the order isomorphism relative to the exponential it should be enough to write `logOrderIso.symm`.

Should we rename it to something like `logExpOrderIso` so it is more evident? Or do you mean that we should actually define an `expOrderIso` as a separate structure (or maybe as `logOrderIso.symm`)?

```suggestion
We prove that `log` and `exp` define order isomorphisms between `ℝ≥0∞` and `EReal`.
```

```suggestion
noncomputable def logHomeomorph : ℝ≥0∞ ≃ₜ EReal := logOrderIso.toHomeomorph
```
This is probably a better name, as this is a single unit, so no underscore in it. No need to deprecate the previous version as it was introduced very recently. Same thing for the exponential.
Could you even register a polish space instance?
We are not sure how to do it. @LorenzoLuccioli

I just committed an attempt at adding the `PolishSpace` instance: 
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/84f997b1aafbf27bda3206e2ff634b5b633b1ff3/Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Log/ENNRealLogExp.lean#L242-L249

I was missing the instance `(uniformity EReal).IsCountablyGenerated` and I tried to prove it adding the `PseudoEMetricSpace` instance to `EReal`. The problem now is that Lean does not recognize that the `UniformSpace` structure induced by the `EDist` and the one induced by the topology are the same, do you know how to prove this?

Moreover I'm not sure whether my implementation of `EDist` satisfies the best practices, and I think it should be moved to some other file, I just left it here temporarily.

I solved the problem with the help of @RemyDegenne, proving that `ENNReal` is a `PolishSpace` since it is isomorphic to a real interval, then we recover the property for `EReal` through the new isomorphism with `ENNReal`. Since it was not needed anymore I erased the definition of `EDist`.

Now I just have to figure out where to position the `PolishSpace` instance for `ENNReal`. 
We cannot put it in the ENNReal [file](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Instances/EReal.html), since it is imported by the file where `PolishSpace` is defined.
We could leave it here, but it seems weird to do that, since it does not really use anything about the log or exp.
`find_home` suggests to put it in the Polish spaces [file](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/MetricSpace/Polish.html), this would avoid any additional import, but in that file there are no instances of specific types to be Polish spaces.
Do you have any suggestions?

I think it would make sense to put it in the file defining PolishSpace, since it can not be put earlier.

Note that if you register the PolishSpace instance, you can remove the metrizable one as it follows from it.

This shouldn't be in the namespace ENNReal, but rather EReal, as your `exp` is defined on `EReal`. (Note that the log should indeed by `ENNReal.log`, as it is defined on `ENNReal`). And the file should probably be named `ERealExp`.
can you avoid `induction'`?

```suggestion
- `EReal.expHomeomorph`: `exp` as a homeomorphism.
```
Things that talk about the log should be in ENNReal, but things that talk about exp should be in EReal.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma logHomeomorph_apply (x : ℝ≥0∞) : logHomeomorph x = log x := rfl
```

```suggestion
noncomputable def _root_.EReal.expHomeomorph : EReal ≃ₜ ℝ≥0∞ := logOrderIso.symm.toHomeomorph
```

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma _root_.EReal.expHomeomorph_apply (x : EReal) : EReal.exp_homeomorph x = exp x := rfl
```
Can you register two simp lemmas saying that logHomeomorph.symm is expHomeomorph and conversely?
I'd rather have the EReal instance in the EReal file, to avoid adding imports to the PolishSpace file. On the other hand, the ENNReal one would fit there perfectly, as it doesn't need new imports.
Ok, I'm going to change that.
@sgouezel Which EReal file? Wouldn't we get build cycle error?
Mathlib/Analysis/SpecialFunctions/Log/ENNRealLogExp.lean
Ah, ok. That's perfect.
Done. Thanks for your help.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma EReal.log_exp (x : EReal) : log (exp x) = x := by
```
No need to open a namespace for a single lemma. Same thing for the next lemma.

```suggestion
/-- `ENNReal.log` and its inverse `EReal.exp` are an order isomorphism between `ℝ≥0∞` and
```

```suggestion
lemma _root_.EReal.measurable_exp : Measurable exp := continuous_exp.measurable
```
could you also add `expOrderIso` in the right namespace? (Replacing the lemma `logOrderIso_symm_apply` with a lemma `logOrderIso_symm`, and adding suitable lemmas).
Mention `EReal.expOrderIso` around here?

```suggestion
- `EReal.log_exp`, `ENNReal.exp_log`: `log` and `exp` are inverses of each other.
```

```suggestion
- `EReal.exp_nmul`, `EReal.exp_mul`: `exp` satisfies the identities `exp (n * x) = (exp x) ^ n`
```

```suggestion
- `EReal` is a Polish space.
```

This is true for any strict mono function, so it has to be a one-liner. Indeed:
```suggestion
lemma log_lt_log_iff {x y : ℝ≥0∞} : log x < log y ↔ x < y := log_strictMono.lt_iff_lt
```

But then this lemma and the lemmas that follow don't use the exponential, and should probably go in the file about log.

```suggestion
lemma log_le_log_iff {x y : ℝ≥0∞} : log x ≤ log y ↔ x ≤ y := log_strictMono.le_iff_le
```
instead of this, you can use `exp_strictMono`, like I did above. And then move this and the following lemmas to the file solely on exp.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SpecialFunctions/Log): Add extended exp
